page.title: 02THE CHURCH IN THORNER
page.content: Thorner has two churches-Methodist and St. Peter's Church of England church. {St. Peter's Church}was founded before Domesday 1086. The present building dates from the 15th Century. The tower has{William Nettleton's}gravestone as its foundation. The church is licensed for funerals, weddings and christenings. There is a regular Sunday School, and a Parish magazine. There is a regular church attendance of 150 out of a population of 2086. {Attendance is increasing slightly,}and more people go to church in a village than do in a town. The vicar helps with pastoral problems and has said that the basic problems of{finance and marriage}do not seem to change with time. No celebrities are buried in the graveyard!
